clusters.title: Israel strikes Gaza, killing 24 before Egypt talks on Trump ceasefire plan

items.title: Israel strikes Gaza, killing 24 before Egypt talks on Trump ceasefire plan
items.standfirst: Israel and Hamas set to hold indirect talks on Monday to discuss a US-led initiative largely accepted by both sides.
items.content: Israel and Hamas set to hold indirect talks on Monday to discuss a US-led initiative largely accepted by both sides.

items.title: Israel and Hamas prepare for crunch ceasefire talks

items.content: Negotiators to meet in Egypt after partial acceptance of Donald Trump’s plan for Gaza

items.title: What to expect as negotiations between Israel and Hamas get underway in Egypt
Israel and Hamas prepare for negotiations in Egypt ahead of possible Gaza ceasefire
Israeli and Hamas negotiators prepare for indirect talks in Egypt ahead of possible ceasefire
items.standfirst: Israel and Hamas prepared for indirect negotiations in Egypt on Monday, as hopes for a possible ceasefire in Gaza grew after Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said a hostage release could be announced this week.
items.content: Israel and Hamas prepared for indirect negotiations in Egypt on Monday, as hopes for a possible ceasefire in Gaza grew after Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said a hostage release could be announced this week.

items.title: Israel-Hamas indirect talks: 'What we've been witnessing, over the past week, is a blame game'
items.standfirst: Israel and Hamas prepared for indirect negotiations in Egypt on Monday (October 6). How close is the Gaza war to ending? Is this time different from previous ceasefire negotiations? For more analysis, FRANCE 24's William Hilderbrandt spoke to Oliver McTernan, director of Forward Thinking. "I think we've always had this precarious situation. What we've been witnessing, I think, over the past week, is a blame game", he said. "It would be a very unwise person who would bet on what the outcome of these talks, in Egypt will be."
items.content: Israel and Hamas prepared for indirect negotiations in Egypt on Monday (October 6). How close is the Gaza war to ending? Is this time different from previous ceasefire negotiations? For more analysis, FRANCE 24's William Hilderbrandt spoke to Oliver McTernan, director of Forward Thinking. "I think we've always had this precarious situation. What we've been witnessing, I think, over the past week, is a blame game", he said. "It would be a very unwise person who would bet on what the outcome of these talks, in Egypt will be."

items.content: Secretary of State Marco Rubio said that ongoing negotiations between Hamas and Israel are not yet the end of the war

items.content: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu declared Israel and Hamas are on the brink of a hostage deal as President Donald Trump’s son-in-law and his Middle East envoy traveled to the region for talks, raising hopes Sunday that the war in Gaza was on the verge of ending

items.content: Families describe a "fragile situation", with negotiations between Israel and Hamas expected to resume.

items.title: Trump federalizes the National Guard in Chicago, while troops arrive in Oregon

items.title: WATCH: Trump criticizes judge who temporarily blocked troop deployment to Portland

items.content: President Donald Trump voiced his frustration on Sunday morning about the ruling by U.S. District Court Judge Karin Immergut, who he appointed during his first term, that is preventing him as of now from deploying troops to Portland.

items.title: Donald Trump says he'll send National Guard to Chicago
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump moved to deploy the National Guard in another city Saturday by authorizing 300 troops to protect federal officers and assets in Chicago, where the government said Border Patrol agents shot and injured a woman while firing at someone who tried to run them over.
items.content: President Donald Trump moved to deploy the National Guard in another city Saturday by authorizing 300 troops to protect federal officers and assets in Chicago, where the government said Border Patrol agents shot and injured a woman while firing at someone who tried to run them over.

items.title: US Judge temporarily blocks Trump administration from deploying troops in Portland
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump authorized deployment of troops to Chicago after a federal agent shot an allegedly armed motorist there on Saturday, while a judge blocked the Republican leader's attempt to send the military into Portland, another Democratic-run city. The escalating crisis across the country pits Trump's increasingly militarized anti-crime and migration crackdown against opposition Democrats who accuse him of an authoritarian power grab. FRANCE 24's Douglas Herbert tells us more.
items.content: US President Donald Trump authorized deployment of troops to Chicago after a federal agent shot an allegedly armed motorist there on Saturday, while a judge blocked the Republican leader's attempt to send the military into Portland, another Democratic-run city. The escalating crisis across the country pits Trump's increasingly militarized anti-crime and migration crackdown against opposition Democrats who accuse him of an authoritarian power grab. FRANCE 24's Douglas Herbert tells us more.

items.title: Trump deploys National Guard to Chicago as judge blocks plan to send troops to Portland
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump authorised deployment of 300 national guardsmen to Chicago after a federal agent shot an allegedly armed motorist there on Saturday, while a judge blocked the attempt to send the military into Portland, another Democratic-run city. Chicago and Portland are the latest flashpoints in the Trump administration's rollout of raids, following the deployment of troops to Los Angeles and Washington.
items.content: US President Donald Trump authorised deployment of 300 national guardsmen to Chicago after a federal agent shot an allegedly armed motorist there on Saturday, while a judge blocked the attempt to send the military into Portland, another Democratic-run city. Chicago and Portland are the latest flashpoints in the Trump administration's rollout of raids, following the deployment of troops to Los Angeles and Washington.

ai_summary: Trump authorized deployment of 300 Illinois National Guard members to Chicago.
California National Guard members were sent to Oregon from California.
A federal judge blocked Trump from deploying Oregon's National Guard.
The California governor vowed to sue Trump over sending troops to Oregon.
The move follows protests and a judge's block on using Oregon's Guard.

clusters.title: Hundreds trapped by blizzard conditions on Mount Everest
clusters.neutral_headline: Blizzard Traps Hundreds on Mount Everest; Rescue Underway

items.title: Hundreds trapped by blizzard conditions on Mount Everest
items.standfirst: Rescue efforts were underway on Sunday on Tibet’s eastern slope of Mount Everest, where nearly 1,000 people were trapped by a blizzard, according to Chinese state media reports. NBC News’ Camila Bernal has the latest.
items.content: Rescue efforts were underway on Sunday on Tibet’s eastern slope of Mount Everest, where nearly 1,000 people were trapped by a blizzard, according to Chinese state media reports. NBC News’ Camila Bernal has the latest.

items.title: Rescue efforts under way after 1,000 people trapped on Mount Everest slopes

items.content: Rescue teams have been deployed to clear the snow on the world's highest mountain, Chinese state media reports.

items.title: Mount Everest rescue under way after snowstorm traps nearly 1,000 people
items.standfirst: Hundreds of trekkers stranded by blizzard on eastern face of mountain in Tibet already guided to safety by rescuersRescue efforts are under way on Mount Everest after a snowstorm trapped nearly 1,000 people in campsites on the eastern side of the mountain, according to Chinese state media.Hundreds of trekkers stranded by a blizzard near the eastern face of the mountain in Tibet were guided to safety by rescuers on Sunday, as unusually heavy precipitation including rain pummelled the Himalayas. Continue reading...

items.title: Hundreds rescued near Mount Everest after being stranded by blizzard

items.content: Hundreds of people have been guided to safety after being stranded in a blizzard near the Tibetan side of Mount Everest, according to Chinese state media.

ai_summary: Nearly 1,000 people were trapped by a blizzard on Mount Everest.
Rescue efforts are underway on the eastern slope in Tibet.
Hundreds of trekkers were guided to safety by rescuers.
Chinese state media reported the rescue efforts.
Unusually heavy precipitation including rain pummeled the Himalayas.

items.title: Who is Japan's 'Iron Lady' Sanae Takaichi?
items.standfirst: The conservative politician, who sees Margaret Thatcher as an inspiration, is set to be Japan's first female prime minister.
items.content: The conservative politician, who sees Margaret Thatcher as an inspiration, is set to be Japan's first female prime minister.

items.title: Japan poised to get first female PM after Sanae Takaichi wins ruling party leadership
items.standfirst: Margaret Thatcher admirer beat her more moderate rival to become leader of Liberal Democratic partyJapan is poised to get its first female prime minister after Sanae Takaichi was elected as leader of the governing Liberal Democratic party (LDP) – a victory that should lead to her being installed as the country’s new leader in the middle of the month.Takaichi, a rightwing politician who has voiced admiration for Margaret Thatcher in her quest to build a “strong and prosperous” Japan on the international stage, beat her moderate rival, Shinjiro Koizumi, in a runoff election at the LDP headquarters in Tokyo on Saturday. Continue reading...
items.content: Margaret Thatcher admirer beat her more moderate rival to become leader of Liberal Democratic partyJapan is poised to get its first female prime minister after Sanae Takaichi was elected as leader of the governing Liberal Democratic party (LDP) – a victory that should lead to her being installed as the country’s new leader in the middle of the month.Takaichi, a rightwing politician who has voiced admiration for Margaret Thatcher in her quest to build a “strong and prosperous” Japan on the international stage, beat her moderate rival, Shinjiro Koizumi, in a runoff election at the LDP headquarters in Tokyo on Saturday. Continue reading...

items.standfirst: Takaichi is a long-time admirer of Margaret Thatcher, but many female voters do not see her as an advocate for progress.
items.content: Takaichi is a long-time admirer of Margaret Thatcher, but many female voters do not see her as an advocate for progress.

clusters.title: Syria holds first elections since fall of Bashar al-Assad
clusters.neutral_headline: Syria Holds First Elections Since Fall of Bashar al-Assad

items.title: Syria holds first elections since fall of Bashar al-Assad
items.standfirst: After more than a decade of civil war, committee members will choose transitional parliamentSyria is holding its first parliamentary elections since the fall of its longtime ruler Bashar al-Assad, in a tentative step towards democratic polls that have been criticised as biased in favour of the country’s interim leaders.As the battle-ravaged country moves through its post-Assad political transition after more than a decade of civil war, members of local committees are beginning the significant milestone of selecting a transitional parliament. Continue reading...
items.content: After more than a decade of civil war, committee members will choose transitional parliamentSyria is holding its first parliamentary elections since the fall of its longtime ruler Bashar al-Assad, in a tentative step towards democratic polls that have been criticised as biased in favour of the country’s interim leaders.As the battle-ravaged country moves through its post-Assad political transition after more than a decade of civil war, members of local committees are beginning the significant milestone of selecting a transitional parliament. Continue reading...

items.title: Video: Here’s how Syria is electing its first post-Assad parliament
items.standfirst: Syria is holding its first indirect parliamentary election since the ouster of longtime ruler Bashar al-Assad.
items.content: Syria is holding its first indirect parliamentary election since the ouster of longtime ruler Bashar al-Assad.

items.title: Syria to select members of first post-Assad parliament in indirect vote
items.standfirst: Members of local committees in Syria began on Sunday (October 5) selecting members of a transitional parliament, in a process criticised as undemocratic, with a third of the members appointed directly by interim leader Ahmed al-Sharaa.
items.content: Members of local committees in Syria began on Sunday (October 5) selecting members of a transitional parliament, in a process criticised as undemocratic, with a third of the members appointed directly by interim leader Ahmed al-Sharaa.

items.title: Everything you need to know about Syria’s first post-Assad elections
items.standfirst: People's Assembly to be chosen by electoral subcommittees in first vote under interim President Ahmed al-Sharaa.
items.content: People's Assembly to be chosen by electoral subcommittees in first vote under interim President Ahmed al-Sharaa.

items.title: Syria: In Raqqa, fear of new episode of violence looms
items.standfirst: Syrian electors will select members of its first post-Assad parliament on Sunday (October 5) in a process criticised, with a third of the members appointed by interim leader Ahmed al-Sharaa. The process is widely expected to consolidate the power of Sharaa and raise more questions about how to unite the country after 13 years of civil war. According to the interim government in Damascus, northeastern Syria has been largely excluded from the electoral process for security reasons. Negotiations are supposed to lead to the integration of this Kurdish-dominated region into the rest of Syria, but in the absence of significant progress, the standoff continues. In Raqqa, Kurdish authorities prepare for any eventuality.
items.content: Syrian electors will select members of its first post-Assad parliament on Sunday (October 5) in a process criticised, with a third of the members appointed by interim leader Ahmed al-Sharaa. The process is widely expected to consolidate the power of Sharaa and raise more questions about how to unite the country after 13 years of civil war. According to the interim government in Damascus, northeastern Syria has been largely excluded from the electoral process for security reasons. Negotiations are supposed to lead to the integration of this Kurdish-dominated region into the rest of Syria, but in the absence of significant progress, the standoff continues. In Raqqa, Kurdish authorities prepare for any eventuality.

items.title: What to expect as Syria holds first parliamentary elections since Assad's ouster
items.standfirst: Syria is holding parliamentary elections on Sunday for the first time since the fall of the country's longtime autocratic leader, Bashar Assad, who was unseated in a rebel offensive in December.
items.content: Syria is holding parliamentary elections on Sunday for the first time since the fall of the country's longtime autocratic leader, Bashar Assad, who was unseated in a rebel offensive in December.(Image credit: Omar Sanadiki)

items.title: Syria holds first parliamentary elections since Assad's ouster in contested process
items.standfirst: Syrians head to the polls on Sunday to vote for the new lawmakers of its first post-Assad parliament in a process criticised as undemocratic, with a third of MPs appointed by interim leader Ahmed al-Sharaa. According to the organising committee, more than 1,500 candidates – just 14 percent of them women – are running for the assembly, which will have a renewable 30-month mandate.
items.content: Syrians head to the polls on Sunday to vote for the new lawmakers of its first post-Assad parliament in a process criticised as undemocratic, with a third of MPs appointed by interim leader Ahmed al-Sharaa. According to the organising committee, more than 1,500 candidates – just 14 percent of them women – are running for the assembly, which will have a renewable 30-month mandate.

ai_summary: Syria is holding its first parliamentary elections since Assad's ouster.
Members of local committees are selecting a transitional parliament.
The process has been criticized as biased and undemocratic.
A third of the members are appointed by interim leader Ahmed al-Sharaa.
Northeastern Syria has been largely excluded from the electoral process.

clusters.title: Georgia protesters try to storm Tbilisi presidential palace

items.title: Georgia protesters try to storm Tbilisi presidential palace
items.standfirst: Police used pepper spray to disperse demonstrators amid growing turmoil in the Caucasus country.
items.content: Police used pepper spray to disperse demonstrators amid growing turmoil in the Caucasus country.

items.title: Georgia protesters try to storm presidential palace in Tbilisi
items.standfirst: Georgia's prime minister says protesters who stormed the presidential palace aimed to overthrow the government.
items.content: Georgia's prime minister says protesters who stormed the presidential palace aimed to overthrow the government.

items.title: Georgian PM vows crackdown on opposition after protests, accuses EU of meddling
items.standfirst: Georgia's Prime Minister Irakli Kobakhidze vowed opposition arrests Sunday (October 5) after police used pepper spray and water cannons against opposition protesters who tried to enter the presidential palace in what he termed was a coup bid during a controversial election. Georgian riot police detained five activists on Saturday, as the opposition staged a large demonstration on a day of local elections.
items.content: Georgia's Prime Minister Irakli Kobakhidze vowed opposition arrests Sunday (October 5) after police used pepper spray and water cannons against opposition protesters who tried to enter the presidential palace in what he termed was a coup bid during a controversial election. Georgian riot police detained five activists on Saturday, as the opposition staged a large demonstration on a day of local elections.

items.title: Georgia’s prime minister announces crackdown on dissent after Tbilisi protests
items.standfirst: Irakli Kobakhidze accused EU ambassador of supporting ‘attempt to overthrow constitutional order’ Georgia’s prime minister, Irakli Kobakhidze, has announced a sweeping crackdown on dissent, accusing demonstrators who tried to storm the presidential palace of aiming to topple his government and blaming the European Union for interference in his country.Kobakhidze levelled his allegations a day after protesters attempted to breach the presidential palace as local elections were being held. They were stopped by riot police using pepper spray and water cannon. Continue reading...
items.content: Irakli Kobakhidze accused EU ambassador of supporting ‘attempt to overthrow constitutional order’ Georgia’s prime minister, Irakli Kobakhidze, has announced a sweeping crackdown on dissent, accusing demonstrators who tried to storm the presidential palace of aiming to topple his government and blaming the European Union for interference in his country.Kobakhidze levelled his allegations a day after protesters attempted to breach the presidential palace as local elections were being held. They were stopped by riot police using pepper spray and water cannon. Continue reading...

items.title: Georgian PM vows crackdown on opposition after protests, accuses EU of meddling
items.standfirst: Georgian Prime Minister Irakli Kobakhidze said that up to 7,000 people attended a rally on Saturday, in a failed "attempt to overthrow the constitutional order" which he alleged was supported by the European Union. Kobakhidze vowed opposition arrests on Sunday, adding that they "will no longer be allowed to be active in Georgian politics".
items.content: Georgian Prime Minister Irakli Kobakhidze said that up to 7,000 people attended a rally on Saturday, in a failed "attempt to overthrow the constitutional order" which he alleged was supported by the European Union. Kobakhidze vowed opposition arrests on Sunday, adding that they "will no longer be allowed to be active in Georgian politics".

items.title: Watch: Protesters attempt to storm Georgia's presidential palace
items.standfirst: Water cannon and pepper spray was used by authorities to disperse protesters.
items.content: Water cannon and pepper spray was used by authorities to disperse protesters.

ai_summary: Protesters tried to storm the presidential palace in Tbilisi.
Police used pepper spray to disperse the demonstrators.
The Prime Minister vowed a crackdown on the opposition.
He accused the EU of meddling in the country's affairs.
Riot police detained five activists during local elections.

items.title: Five killed in large Russian missile and drone attack, Zelensky says

items.content: Russia says it carried out an overnight strike on Ukrainian military and infrastructure targets.

items.title: At least 5 dead in large-scale nighttime Russian strike on Ukraine
items.standfirst: At least five civilians died after Russia launched a major nighttime attack on Ukraine overnight into Sunday, a barrage which officials said targeted civilian infrastructure.
items.content: At least five civilians died after Russia launched a major nighttime attack on Ukraine overnight into Sunday, a barrage which officials said targeted civilian infrastructure.(Image credit: AP)

items.title: Russia launches deadly missile and drone attack on Ukraine - as Poland forced to scramble jets
items.standfirst: At least five people have been killed in a massive Russian missile and drone attack on Ukraine, Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said.
items.content: At least five people have been killed in a massive Russian missile and drone attack on Ukraine, Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said.

items.title: At least five killed in large-scale overnight Russian strikes on Ukraine, Poland scrambles jets
items.standfirst: At lease five civilians were killed after Russian launched a large-scale night-time attack in Ukraine that officials there said targeted civilian infrastructure. NATO member Poland said it scrambled aircraft early on Sunday to ensure its air safety after Russian missiles and drones rained down on the Lviv region near the Polish border.
items.content: At lease five civilians were killed after Russian launched a large-scale night-time attack in Ukraine that officials there said targeted civilian infrastructure. NATO member Poland said it scrambled aircraft early on Sunday to ensure its air safety after Russian missiles and drones rained down on the Lviv region near the Polish border.

ai_summary: Russia launched a large-scale nighttime attack on Ukraine.
At least five civilians were killed in the attack.
The attack targeted civilian infrastructure, officials said.
Poland scrambled jets to ensure its air safety.
The attack occurred in the Lviv region near Poland.

items.standfirst: Proposed government overhaul of house purchase process looks at shifting some costs from buyers to sellersMinisters are attempting to cut the time it takes to buy a home by four weeks under new proposals aimed at overhauling the housebuying process.The UK government will also consult on plans to shift costs from buyers to sellers, including compelling sellers and estate agents to provide buyers with vital information – such as the condition of the home and the scale of any leasehold costs – upfront. clusters.title: France’s new prime minister names a government that might not last long
clusters.neutral_headline: France’s new prime minister names a government that might not last long

items.title: France’s new prime minister names a government that might not last long
items.standfirst: France's new prime minister has named a government, bringing back former finance minister Bruno Le Maire as defense minister
items.content: France's new prime minister has named a government, bringing back former finance minister Bruno Le Maire as defense minister

items.title: France unveils new government led by Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu
items.standfirst: French President Emmanuel Macron’s office on Sunday unveiled the members of the country’s new government, which will be led by Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu. Former finance minister Bruno Le Maire will return to the government as France’s new defence minister, while others, like Interior Minister Bruno Retailleau and Foreign Minister Jean-Noël Barrot, will stay in their posts.
items.content: French President Emmanuel Macron’s office on Sunday unveiled the members of the country’s new government, which will be led by Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu. Former finance minister Bruno Le Maire will return to the government as France’s new defence minister, while others, like Interior Minister Bruno Retailleau and Foreign Minister Jean-Noël Barrot, will stay in their posts.

items.title: How apple cider vinegar cured everything — until it didn't
items.standfirst: A headline-grabbing study touting apple cider vinegar for weight loss has been retracted. Other claims for the internet-famous remedy are also under fire.
items.content: A headline-grabbing study touting apple cider vinegar for weight loss has been retracted. Other claims for the internet-famous remedy are also under fire.(Image credit: Jeremy Drey)

ai_summary: A study touting apple cider vinegar for weight loss has been retracted.
The retraction was due to concerns about the quality of the work.
Other claims for the remedy are also under fire.

items.title: Costco to sell weight-loss drugs such as Ozempic and Wegovy at half-price
items.standfirst: Costco has struck an agreement with drugmaker Novo Nordisk to make anti-obesity GLP-1 medications such as Ozempic and Wegovy available to its members at roughly half the usual cost. Through the store’s prescription program, members with a valid prescription can buy a four-week supply of the…
items.content: Costco has struck an agreement with drugmaker Novo Nordisk to make anti-obesity GLP-1 medications such as Ozempic and Wegovy available to its members at roughly half the usual cost. Through the store’s prescription program, members with a valid prescription can buy a four-week supply of the…

items.title: Costco to sell weight-loss drugs such as Ozempic and Wegovy at half-price
items.standfirst: The move comes as GLP-1 drug prices have soared as supply continues to be increasingly limitedCostco has struck an agreement with drugmaker Novo Nordisk to make anti-obesity GLP-1 medications such as Ozempic and Wegovy available to its members at roughly half the usual cost.Through the store’s prescription program, members with a valid prescription can buy a four-week supply of the injectables for $499. The offer is available only to those paying out of pocket, since many insurers still do not cover these medications. Continue reading...
items.content: The move comes as GLP-1 drug prices have soared as supply continues to be increasingly limitedCostco has struck an agreement with drugmaker Novo Nordisk to make anti-obesity GLP-1 medications such as Ozempic and Wegovy available to its members at roughly half the usual cost.Through the store’s prescription program, members with a valid prescription can buy a four-week supply of the injectables for $499. The offer is available only to those paying out of pocket, since many insurers still do not cover these medications. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Costco will offer anti-obesity medications like Ozempic and Wegovy at approximately half price.
The offer is available to members with prescriptions through the store's prescription program.
A four-week supply of the injectables will cost $499 for those paying out of pocket.
Many insurance providers do not currently cover these weight-loss medications.
The move comes as GLP-1 drug prices have increased due to limited supply.

clusters.title: Andrej Babiš to hold talks with other Czech parties on forming government
clusters.neutral_headline: Andrej Babiš to Hold Talks on Czech Government Formation

items.title: Andrej Babiš to hold talks with other Czech parties on forming government
items.standfirst: Billionaire faces tricky task trying to secure enough support to become PM after ANO wins elections without majorityAndrej Babiš has met the Czech president, Petr Pavel, and is to hold talks with other party leaders as the billionaire populist begins the tricky job of trying to form a stable government after his ANO (Yes) party won parliamentary elections, but failed to secure a majority.Final results showed ANO won 34.5% of the vote, held on Friday and Saturday, translating to a provisional 80 seats in the 200-member parliament. The centre-right Spolu coalition of the outgoing prime minister, Petr Fiala, came second on 23.4%. Continue reading...
items.content: Billionaire faces tricky task trying to secure enough support to become PM after ANO wins elections without majorityAndrej Babiš has met the Czech president, Petr Pavel, and is to hold talks with other party leaders as the billionaire populist begins the tricky job of trying to form a stable government after his ANO (Yes) party won parliamentary elections, but failed to secure a majority.Final results showed ANO won 34.5% of the vote, held on Friday and Saturday, translating to a provisional 80 seats in the 200-member parliament. The centre-right Spolu coalition of the outgoing prime minister, Petr Fiala, came second on 23.4%. Continue reading...

items.title: Billionaire populist Andrej Babis' party wins Czech parliamentary election
items.standfirst: However, his ANO party falls short of an overall majority in preliminary results.
items.content: However, his ANO party falls short of an overall majority in preliminary results.

ai_summary: Andrej Babiš, after his party's election win, will hold talks with other parties.
His ANO party won the election but did not secure a majority in parliament.
ANO received 34.5% of the vote, translating to 80 seats in the 200-member parliament.
The Spolu coalition came second with 23.4% of the vote.
Babiš faces the challenge of forming a stable government.

items.content: Activists from the Global Sumud Flotilla who hoped to reach Gaza have been deported after being intercepted and detained

items.title: Israel steps up deportations of flotilla activists
items.standfirst: Another 137 people from 14 countries were deported after being detained while trying to deliver aid to Gaza.
items.content: Another 137 people from 14 countries were deported after being detained while trying to deliver aid to Gaza.

ai_summary: Activists deported from Israel after the Gaza flotilla arrest allege mistreatment.
They claim they were treated "like monkeys" during their detention.
The activists were intercepted and detained while trying to deliver aid to Gaza.
Israel has stepped up deportations of flotilla activists.
Another 137 people from 14 countries were deported.

items.title: Gaza bombarded despite Donald Trump telling Israel to stop
items.standfirst: Israel struck Gaza killing dozens, in spite of Trump's call for it to immediately halt its bombing.
items.content: Israel struck Gaza killing dozens, in spite of Trump's call for it to immediately halt its bombing.

items.title: Israel strikes Gaza despite ceasefire progress after Trump calls for bombing to stop
items.standfirst: Israeli airstrikes hit the Gaza Strip on Saturday, local authorities said, hours after President Donald Trump called to halt the bombing, saying that Hamas was ready for peace
items.content: Israeli airstrikes hit the Gaza Strip on Saturday, local authorities said, hours after President Donald Trump called to halt the bombing, saying that Hamas was ready for peace

ai_summary: Israel struck Gaza, resulting in casualties, despite Trump's call for a halt.
Israeli airstrikes hit Gaza on Saturday, according to local authorities.
Trump had called for a halt to the bombing, stating Hamas was ready for peace.
The strikes occurred after reports of progress toward a ceasefire.
The situation remains tense with ongoing conflict.

clusters.title: Video: Huge pro-Palestinian protests held in cities across Europe

items.title: Video: Huge pro-Palestinian protests held in cities across Europe
items.standfirst: Massive pro-Palestinian protests have been held in cities across Europe to condemn Israel's war on Gaza.
items.content: Massive pro-Palestinian protests have been held in cities across Europe to condemn Israel's war on Gaza.

items.title: Massive marches across Europe protest Israel's military campaign in Gaza
items.standfirst: Huge numbers turned out at pro-Palestinian rallies in Europe on Saturday (October 4), calling for an immediate end to the war in Gaza and the release of activists on board a flotilla carrying humanitarian aid to the territory.
items.content: Huge numbers turned out at pro-Palestinian rallies in Europe on Saturday (October 4), calling for an immediate end to the war in Gaza and the release of activists on board a flotilla carrying humanitarian aid to the territory.

ai_summary: Massive pro-Palestinian protests occurred in European cities.
Protesters condemned Israel's war on Gaza.
Demonstrations called for an immediate end to the war.
Protesters demanded the release of activists from the aid flotilla.
Large numbers participated in rallies across Europe.

clusters.title: Egypt opens Amenhotep III's tomb to public, after over 20 years of renovation
clusters.neutral_headline: Egypt Opens Amenhotep III's Tomb After Renovation

items.title: Egypt opens Amenhotep III's tomb to public, after over 20 years of renovation
items.standfirst: Egypt on Saturday (October 4) opened a tomb of a pharaoh for visitors after more than two decades of renovation in the southern city of Luxor, as it prepares for the official opening of the Grand Egyptian Museum in Cairo.
items.content: Egypt on Saturday (October 4) opened a tomb of a pharaoh for visitors after more than two decades of renovation in the southern city of Luxor, as it prepares for the official opening of the Grand Egyptian Museum in Cairo.

items.title: Pharaoh's tomb in Egypt's Valley of the Kings reopens to the public
items.standfirst: The huge tomb of Amenhotep III, who ruled ancient Egypt between 1390 B.C. and 1350 B.C., is carved into the hillside on the west bank of the Nile River in the southern Egyptian city of Luxor.
items.content: The huge tomb of Amenhotep III, who ruled ancient Egypt between 1390 B.C. and 1350 B.C., is carved into the hillside on the west bank of the Nile River in the southern Egyptian city of Luxor.

ai_summary: Egypt opened Amenhotep III's tomb to the public after over 20 years of renovation.
The tomb is located in Luxor, in southern Egypt.
The reopening is part of preparations for the Grand Egyptian Museum opening.
Amenhotep III ruled ancient Egypt between 1390 B.C. and 1350 B.C.
The tomb is carved into the hillside on the west bank of the Nile River.
